text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Neo-Geo CD is a game console launched in 1994 in Japan by SNK. It is based on the architecture of the Neo-Geo, but uses CD-ROMs instead of cartridges, with the aim to reduce the price of games. This advantage is also its main drawback, its transfer speed of 150 kio / s (single speed) associated with the small amount of RAM (56Mo) imposing longer loading times during the game. Conversion of game cartridges effected some graphics and animations, decreasing the load. As a result, the main interest of this system are its exclusives games or with music remix.
